Submodules¶

users.admin module¶

Admin configuration for the users application. Extends the standard Django UserAdmin to support custom role management and auditing.

class users.admin.CustomUserAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]¶

Bases: UserAdmin

Admin configuration for the Custom User model.

fieldsets = ((None, {'fields': ('username', 'password')}), ('Personal info', {'fields': ('first_name', 'last_name', 'email')}), ('Permissions', {'fields': ('is_active', 'is_staff', 'is_superuser', 'groups', 'user_permissions')}), ('Important dates', {'fields': ('last_login', 'date_joined')}), ('Role', {'fields': ('role',)}))¶
property media¶

users.apps module¶

Application configuration for the users application. Initializes custom user management and ensures authentication signals are correctly registered.

class users.apps.UsersConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]¶

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the users app.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'¶
name = 'users'¶
ready()[source]¶

Connect signals for the users app.

users.forms module¶

Forms for the users application. Defines user registration, login, and profile management forms with role-based validation.

class users.forms.SimpleUserRegistrationForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]¶

Bases: ModelForm

Form for registering a new user with basic details.

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Save the user with the correctly hashed password.

users.models module¶

Models for the users application. Defines the custom User model with integrated role-based access control and profile management.

class users.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model used for the News Application. Supports role-based access such as reader, journalist, and editor.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = (('reader', 'Reader'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'), ('editor', 'Editor'))¶
approved_articles¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

users.signals module¶

Signal handlers for the users application. Automatically assigns users to the correct Django Permission Groups based on their selected role.

users.signals.assign_user_group(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]¶

Signal handler to automatically assign a user to the appropriate group based on their role. Triggered after a User instance is saved.

users.signals.setup_groups()[source]¶

Set up user groups (Readers, Journalists, Editors) with appropriate permissions. Creates groups if they don’t exist and assigns article-related permissions.

users.test_logout module¶

class users.test_logout.LogoutFunctionalityTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: TestCase

Test suite to verify the logout functionality of the news application.

setUp()[source]¶

Set up test user for logout testing.

test_cannot_access_protected_pages_after_logout()[source]¶

Test that protected pages are inaccessible after logout.

test_django_logout_url()[source]¶

Test that accessing /accounts/logout/ also works.

test_django_logout_url_get()[source]¶

Test that accessing /accounts/logout/ via GET also works.

test_landing_page_logs_out_user()[source]¶

Test that accessing the landing page (/) logs out the user.

test_logout_clears_session()[source]¶

Test that logout properly clears the user session.

users.test_registration_login module¶

class users.test_registration_login.RegistrationLoginTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: TestCase

setUp()[source]¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_existing_user_new_role_registration_logs_in_automatically()[source]¶

Test that an existing user registering for a new role is automatically logged in with that role.

test_new_user_registration_logs_in_automatically()[source]¶

Test that a newly registered user is automatically logged in.

users.tests module¶

class users.tests.UserRoleTests(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for validating role-based properties and permissions in the User model.

setUp()[source]¶

Set up test users with different roles (reader, journalist, editor) and a test publisher.

test_editor_properties()[source]¶

Test that an Editor (who is neither pure reader nor journalist in this context) returns None for specific role fields if not applicable.

test_journalist_properties()[source]¶

Test that a Journalist has access to authored items but returns None for reader fields.

test_reader_properties()[source]¶

Test that a Reader has access to subscriptions but returns None for journalist fields.

users.urls module¶

users.views module¶

Views for the users application. Handles user authentication, registration, role selection, and profile viewing logic.

users.views.custom_login(request)[source]¶

Authenticate a user and validate the selected role before login.

Ensures that the user is registered for the chosen role before granting access.

users.views.get_user_roles(request)[source]¶

Return the roles associated with a given username.

Used by the frontend to dynamically display available roles.

users.views.landing_page(request)[source]¶

Log out the current user and redirect to the login page.

users.views.register(request)[source]¶

Handle user registration with support for multiple roles.

Allows an existing user to register additional roles if credentials match, or creates a new user with the selected role.

users.views.verify_credentials(request)[source]¶

Verify user credentials and return available roles.

Used by AJAX requests to validate login details before role selection.

Module contents¶

Initialization for the users application package.
